root: ^!The inside of the coffee shop is incredibly warm and inviting. Vinyl records line the walls and patrons lounge around on well-worn-in couches. Some cool tunes spin on a record player next to a little stage.
^$Welcome to Cafe Fork, guys! I’m Madi. How’s it going?
^%It gets mentioned in this poem I like, and I thought it was a good idea at the time, and I suppose now it’s still a good idea because like, the business is still running?

^%But people ask me that question all the time and I give them this same answer every time and now I’m standing here rambling and I’m sure we’re all getting more and more uncomfortable the more I keep talking but man we’re in it now and I can’t stop.
^!I scan the chalkboard menu and am immediately overwhelmed.

CONTINUE: ^%Coming right up! Do you want that in Small, Medium, or Biggie Smalls?
^%Wait, is Biggie Smalls big or small?
^!Madi sets to making our drinks and Amelia and I take a seat on one of the couches.
^%Let the woman make her puns. They’re cooler bands than you listen to, anyways.
^!This couch is actually pretty comfy. Maybe not comfier than our couch, but it’s alright. Good lumbar support. You sink right into it.
^%This place is right next to our house and that lady seems not only cool but also just as uncomfortable with talking to other people as you are.
^%You should totally be friends with her.
^%C’mon, what’d we say about meeting new people?
^%I can’t meet new people if I always stay inside and also don’t go outside and also don’t talk to people.
^!Madi sets our drinks down at our table and I immediately take a sip.
^%Hi! We’re new in the neighborhood! I’m Amelia and this is my Mom!
^$Oh right on! Pleased to meet you both!
^%Let me introduce you to my daughter. You two might get along.
^!Madi turns toward the employee only section.
^!A young girl with green overalls walks out of the employee only section and towards our table.
^%I'm Amelia. Nice to meet you, Camilla.
^%I have to go do my homework, but it was nice to meet you.
^!Camilla runs back to the employee section.
^%You know what? Lemme get your guys’ opinion on something.
^!Madi goes into the back and comes out with a fresh plate of something that smells amazing.
^%I’m working on a new banana bread recipe and I need help coming up with a name for it.
^%Well, I think we’re gonna have to taste test it first so we can uh… get the full flavor profile of… you know, and really appreciate the flavor sensations of…
^!Amelia nods vigorously. She knows this game.
^%Yeah, we need to give that ‘nana bread a taste if you want us doing free creative labor, I think that would be commensurate with… uh…
^!I’ve taught her well. We have trained for this day.
^%I was just gonna give you guys free banana bread anyway.
^!Madi serves us each a piece. Amelia and I happily chow down.
^%Well, I think I might only be able to give you Mom Band puns, but I’ll give it a shot.

c-1: ^That... actually has a nice ring to it. Strong decisions. That's art, baby!
c-2: ^Hmm... I don't think I get it.

CONTINUE2: ^$Hey, I was actually wondering if you would want to go to a concert later today. It seems like you also have an interest in bands!
^!We finish up our drinks and head out.
^%Thanks for stopping in! See you later.
^!Madi awkwardly winks at me. I blush in response.
